meanings.definition: To make into or explain as a myth.
meanings.sent1: The storyteller mythicized the ancient hero's journey.
meanings.sent2: The ancient civilization's history was mythicized over time.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they mythicized their pet cat's adventures.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was so strong that she mythicized him into a legendary figure.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush strokes mythicized the ordinary landscape into a magical realm.

meanings.definition: To give a mythical quality to.
meanings.sent1: The glowing lights mythicized the forest at night.
meanings.sent2: The ancient ruins were mythicized by the eerie mist surrounding them.
meanings.sent3: The chef's special sauce mythicized the simple dish into a gourmet masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: The old castle's grandeur mythicized the bygone era of kings and queens.
meanings.sent5: The haunting melody mythicized the tragic love story of the star-crossed lovers.
